meanings.definition: A person who deceives or misleads others, especially in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: The bluffers in the card game tried to trick their opponents with fake tells.
meanings.sent2: The group of bluffers at the poker table were skilled at hiding their true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The bluffers in the chess tournament pretended to make a mistake, only to surprise everyone with a brilliant move.
meanings.sent4: She was a master bluffer, able to make her opponents believe anything she wanted.
meanings.sent5: The bluffers in the quiz show managed to outsmart the other contestants with their clever tactics.

meanings.definition: To deceive or mislead someone by pretending to be more capable or knowledgeable than one actually is.
meanings.sent1: He tried to bluffers his way through the interview by exaggerating his qualifications.
meanings.sent2: She always bluffers about her cooking skills, but her burnt dishes tell the truth.
meanings.sent3: The comedian bluffers his way through the routine, making up jokes on the spot.
meanings.sent4: The politician bluffers his opponents with promises he knows he can't keep.
meanings.sent5: The student bluffers his understanding of the topic, hoping the teacher won't notice.
